page.title: 03THE CLAPPERS (CONINUED)
page.content: English for rabbit warren. Locally, the Clappers provide a popular walking and picnic area which is easily accessible by road. Recently more young beech trees have been planted near the entrance, in the picnic area. By following the path around the top of the hill, a quite outstanding view of the surrounding countryside is obtained. Skylarks can often be seen and heard flying over the farmland neary. In the area parsley piert, white mustard and ploughman's spikehard can be found, as well as the sighting of many wall butterflies. On the exposed sides of the hill it can be very windy and when the wind is in a particular direction, experienced members of the Dustable Hang-gliding Club, have special permission to use the Clappers for gliding.
